Pamela Holt of Granger, Indiana was diagnosed with multiple Myelomaâ€”an incurable form of blood cancer. She was paying nearly $5K the first month and then more than $8K out of pocket over the rest of the year for her medicine. #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/rSp0eVyA28

That is a 40% price increase.  #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/xti9GVkdYx

"These skyrocketing prices are forcing families to take on debt, sacrifice their homes, or sacrifice their health altogether.â€
Watch now Chairman @RepCummings' opening statement from todayâ€™s hearing examining  skyrocketing #drugprices. #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/LNzibIwoO3
"Our investigation will allow the American public to lift the veil on the industry's pricing practices. And we will help inform the policy solutions to bring #drugprices down." -Chairman @RepCummings

The Committee will take all steps necessary to ensure full compliance with our investigation, including with our requests to companies for documents showing why they are increasing prices so dramatically, how they are using the proceeds & what steps can be taken to reduce prices.

"That is why the Committee has been investigating the pharmaceutical industry's price increases. This investigation, which began in January, focuses on the 17 highest cost drugs for the Medicare Part D program."
"Think about that. Americans are dying every year while  pharmaceutical companies  enjoy more and more profits."

"Imagine having to pick between having a roof over your head or protecting  your child' s  life.  Between eating that day or taking a pill that you need to stay alive. For Americans around the country, these situations are an everyday reality."

"Many families have to choose between caring for themselves and their loved ones or paying for basic necessities.

These skyrocketing prices are forcing families to take on debt, sacrifice their homes, or sacrifice their health altogether."

"I fear you will discover that we are facing a drug pricing crisis in this country.

We have seen it time and time again. Drug companies' skyrocketing prices are forcing families to make gut-wrenching choices."

"Today, five patients and family members are here to share their stories. I urge all members to go back to your districts and talk to your constituents about their experiences struggling to pay for life-saving drugs."

"Today we are closing this work period the way we started our work this Congressâ€” with a hearing on #prescriptiondrugprices. This is a bipartisan issue that I have focused on for years"-Chairman @RepCummings

â€œWe hope Ms. Conway will reconsider. But if she does not, we will hold a business meeting on July 25 to hold her in contempt. â€œ -Chairman @RepCummings
â€œThis is about holding our government to the highest standard and not allowing individuals appointed by the #President to be given special treatment when they flagrantly violate the law.â€

â€œWe are requiring her to testify before Congress about her multiple violations of federal law, her waste of taxpayer funds, and her actions that compromise public confidence in the integrity of the federal government."
â€œWe are not requiring her to testify about advice she gave the #President or about the White Houseâ€™s policy decisions.â€
â€œThat is a completely baseless claim.  Our Committee has heard testimony from many White House officials under both Republican and Democratic Administrations. â€œ

â€œWhy is she not here? Just 25 minutes ago, the #WhiteHouse sent a letter to the Committee claiming Ms. Conway is â€œabsolutely immuneâ€ from having to testify before Congress simply because she works in the #WhiteHouse.

â€œNow, today, Ms. Conway is violating a duly authorized subpoena issued by this Committee.  Ms. Conway is required to be here today to address her multiple violations of federal law, many of which occurred on national television.â€

â€œ#TheHatchAct prohibits federal employees from using their official positions for partisan political purposes.  The law ensures that the federal government is administered in a nonpartisan manner and that federal employees are protected from political coercion in the workplace.â€
â€œSince Ms. Conway joined the White House in January 2017, she has repeatedly and flagrantly abused her position of trust.â€

â€œThe Committee then voted to authorize a subpoena to compel her to testify here today.  In defiance of that subpoena, Ms. Conway is again refusing to appear.â€ https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/oversight-committee-authorizes-bipartisan-subpoena-to-kellyanne-conway-forÂ â€¦

"The federal government should be providing national leadership and resources to combat this public health epidemic.

â€œWe invited the Acting Director of the Office of Management and Budget, Russell Vought, to testify at todayâ€™s hearing. But he declined to appear.  Apparently, he did not want to answer these questions.â€-Chairman @RepCummings

â€œWe wanted to hear from the #TrumpAdmin about why they suddenly reversed their position in the litigation.  We wanted to know what the Administrationâ€™s plan is for millions of people if they win in court and invalidate the whole #ACA.â€

â€œIronically, if the #TrumpAdmin is successful in striking down the entire #ACA, it would directly undermine many of their own policy goals, including tackling the opioid epidemic, lowering prescription drug prices, and ending the HIV epidemic.â€

â€œHowever, since #PresidentTrump took office in January 2017, neither the Administration nor congressional Republicans have offered a plan to replace the #ACA that would prevent significant coverage losses or the elimination of consumer protections.â€

"And insurance companies in the individual and small group markets would not have to cover essential services such as preventive care, hospitalization, emergency services, maternity care, and prescription drugs.â€

"People with pre-existing conditionsâ€”like diabetes, cancer, HIV, asthma, substance use disorder, or even pregnancyâ€”could be denied health care coverage or charged more.  Babies born with health conditions could be uninsurable for their whole lives."
â€œWhen Congress passed the #ACA in 2010, we enshrined into law the promise that all Americans have the right to accessible, affordable health insurance coverage.â€
â€œIf the #TrumpAdminâ€™s position prevails and the entire #ACA is struck down, there will be catastrophic implications for millions of Americans and the entire United States health care system.â€

â€œOn March 25, the #TrumpAdmin filed a two-sentence letter with the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit reversing its own previous position in the case of Texas v. U.S. and asserting that it would not defend any portion of the #ACA in court.â€ -Chairman @RepCummings
